Ultimate Fighting Championship CEO Dana White speaks at an election night event for President-elect Donald Trump West Palm Beach, Florida on Nov. 6. Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta has named White to its board of directors.

Dana White, the Ultimate Fighting Championship president and supporter of President-elect Donald Trump, is joining the board of Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta.

White's election as a Meta director two weeks before Trump takes office comes as Silicon Valley is [courting the incoming administration](https://www.npr.org/2024/12/16/nx-s1-5227120/tech-executives-are-courting-trump), following what has been a frosty relationship with Trump and his allies, who have long accused tech platforms including Meta of anti-conservative bias.

Meta, Amazon, and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have [each donated $1 million to Trump's inauguration fund](https://www.npr.org/2024/12/13/nx-s1-5227874/trump-bezos-zuckerberg-amazon-facebook-open-ai-meta-inauguration-fund). Zuckerberg is among the tech titans who have dined with the president-elect at Mar-a-Lago since the election. Last week [Meta named Joel Kaplan](https://www.reuters.com/technology/meta-taps-republican-joel-kaplan-lead-global-policy-team-replacing-nick-clegg-2025-01-02/), a veteran company executive and Republican who once worked in George W. Bush's White House, its head of global policy.

White is a longtime friend of Trump [who spoke at the Republican National Convention](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/18/g-s1-11894/hulk-hogan-rnc) this summer and appeared in Trump's first TikTok video. On election night, White joined Trump on stage at his victory party, thanking many of the podcasters and [online influencers](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/21/nx-s1-5196987/influencers-are-now-a-source-of-news-for-many-americans) who, along with UFC, have been credited with boosting the president-elect's [appeal among young men](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/22/nx-s1-5152587/attending-ufc-events-is-key-for-trump-to-reach-his-political-base).

White and Zuckerberg, [who has trained as a mixed martial arts fighter](https://www.npr.org/2023/06/06/1180326042/video-mark-zuckerberg-jiu-jitsu-match-facebook), have also become friendly. Zuckerberg praised White for building UFC into "one of the most valuable, fastest growing, and most popular sports enterprises in the world" in a [Facebook post](https://www.facebook.com/zuck/posts/pfbid0e4XWTKpPFm3PP44o17EQK3LazXFLKn9ABBGAUYKKBvKo3MJDvLMehcG9Bb7yYZqPl) on Monday. "I've admired him as an entrepreneur and his ability to build such a beloved brand," Zuckerberg continued.

"I've never been interested in joining a board of directors until I got the offer to join Meta's board. I am a huge believer that social media and AI are the future," White said in a [statement](https://about.fb.com/news/2025/01/dana-white-john-elkann-charlie-songhurst-meta-board-of-directors/). White has talked with Zuckerberg about using artificial intelligence to improve UFC rankings, [ESPN reported](https://www.espn.com/mma/story/_/id/41999046/dana-white-mark-zuckerberg-talk-fixes-ufc-rankings-system) in October.

Meta also named as directors John Elkann, CEO of the European investment firm Ekon and executive chairman of carmakers Stellantis and Ferrari, and Charlie Songhurst, a tech investor who previously led corporate strategy at Microsoft. Songhurst joined a group advising Meta on AI last year.

The additions expand Meta's board from 10 to 13 directors, including Zuckerberg, who serves as chair.

"We have massive opportunities ahead in AI, wearables, and the future of social media, and our board will help us achieve our vision," Zuckerberg wrote in his Facebook post announcing the new members.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday met Microsoft Chairman and CEO Satya Nadella in the national capital and discussed various aspects of technology, innovation and AI.

Nadella said Microsoft is excited to build on the commitment to make India AI-first.

"Thank you, PM @narendramodiji for your leadership. Excited to build on our commitment to making India AI-first and work together on our continued expansion in the country to ensure every Indian benefits from this AI platform shift," Nadella said in a post on X.

Responding to the post, PM Modi said he was glad to know about [Microsoft's ambitious expansion and investment plans in India.](https://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/technology/not-seeing-slowdown-in-tech-spends-rather-lot-of-momentum-around-ai-copilot-microsoft-india-president/article68827672.ece)

"It was indeed a delight to meet you, Satya Nadella! Glad to know about Microsoft's ambitious expansion and investment plans in India. It was also wonderful discussing various aspects of tech, innovation and AI in our meeting," he said in a post on X.

[Microsoft plans to spend $80 billion on AI-enabled data centers in fiscal 2025](https://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/technology/microsoft-plans-to-spend-80-billion-on-ai-enabled-data-centers-in-fiscal-2025/article69060293.ece)

![Image 12](https://www.thehindu.com/theme/images/th-online/1x1_spacer.png)

Earlier in the day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi met US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan and said that the India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership has scaled new heights, including in the areas of technology, defence and space.

The Prime Minister said he is looking forward to building upon this momentum in bilateral ties for the benefit of the people of the two countries.

"It was a pleasure to meet the US National Security Advisor, @JakeSullivan46. The India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership has scaled new heights, including in the areas of technology, defence, space, biotechnology and artificial intelligence. Look forward to building upon this momentum in ties between our two democracies for the benefit of our people and global good," PM said in a post on X.

[![Image 2: Еврокомиссия начала антимонопольное расследование в отношении Apple](https://knews.kg/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Apple-300x156.jpg)](https://knews.kg/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Apple.jpg)

**Корпорация Apple [заявила](https://www.bbc.com/russian/articles/cm2lmj23n37o), что обновит программное обеспечение, которое генерировало некорректные новостные уведомления на последних моделях iPhone, используя технологии искусственного интеллекта.**

В понедельник компания впервые признала наличие проблемы и заявила, что намерена «более четко разъяснить» пользователю, когда уведомления являются сводками, сгенерированными новой ИИ-платформой Apple Intelligence.

Система была анонсирована прошлым летом и в октябре начала работать на новых устройствах Apple, однако пока доступна в бета-версии не во всех регионах, а дополнительные функции компания обещает добавить позднее.

В декабре Би-би-си пожаловалась на работу Apple Intelligence, после того как в сгенерированном ИИ резюме нескольких заголовков, которое появилось в виде уведомления на экранах телефонах пользователей приложения BBC News, ложно сообщалось, что обвиняемый в убийстве главы UnitedHealthcare Луиджи Манджоне застрелился.

В пятницу искусственный интеллект от Apple снова неверно суммировал уведомления приложения Би-би-си и сообщил пользователям, что Люк Литтлер выиграл чемпионат мира по дартсу (за несколько часов до финала), а испанский теннисист Рафаэль Надаль совершил каминг-аут.

«Эти ИИ-обобщения от Apple не отражают, а в некоторых случаях полностью противоречат оригинальному контенту Би-би-си, — говорится в заявлении корпорации. — Крайне важно, чтобы Apple срочно решила эти проблемы, поскольку точность наших новостей имеет решающее значение для поддержания доверия аудитории».

Apple заявила, что обновление выйдет в ближайшие недели.

«Функции Apple Intelligence находятся в бета-версии, и мы постоянно улучшаем их с помощью отзывов пользователей», — говорится в заявлении компании.

«Обновление программного обеспечения в ближайшие недели уточнит, когда отображаемый текст является обобщением, сделанным Apple Intelligence. Мы призываем пользователей сообщать о проблемах, если они видят неожиданные сводки уведомлений».

Apple Intelligence на устройствах Apple не включена по умолчанию, при желании пользователь может сделать это в настройках. Функцию «сводки уведомлений» также можно отключить.

Title: UFC head Dana White joins Meta’s board, Mark Zuckerberg’s second key right-wing appointment in a week

URL Source: https://kvia.com/news/business-technology/cnn-business-consumer/2025/01/06/ufc-head-dana-white-joins-metas-board-mark-zuckerbergs-second-key-right-wing-appointment-in-a-week/

Published Time: 2025-01-06T22:28:45+00:00

Markdown Content:
By Clare Duffy, CNN

**New York (CNN) —** Meta has named three new members to its board of directors, including Dana White, the Ultimate Fighting Championship chief executive who played a key role in the reelection of his [longtime friend](https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/14/politics/video/ufc-ceo-dana-white-trump-friendship-sot-lcl-digvid), President-elect Donald Trump.

Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced White’s appointment — along with Charlie Songhurst, a tech investor who has been advising Meta on artificial intelligence, and John Elkann, CEO of Exor, a holding company that owns several automotive and other brands — in a Facebook [post](https://www.facebook.com/zuck/) Monday. “We have massive opportunities ahead in AI, wearables, and the future of social media, and our board will help us achieve our vision,” Zuckerberg said.

The new additions bring the social media giant’s board to 13 directors, including Zuckerberg.

White’s appointment is particularly notable as it comes amid a broader apparent ideological shift to the right within Meta’s top ranks, and as Zuckerberg seeks to improve his relationship with Trump before the president-elect takes office later this month.

White [stumped for Trump](https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/22/media/dana-white-ufc-trump-politics/index.html) on the 2024 campaign trail, praised him at the Republican National Convention and walked alongside him at a November UFC match at Madison Square Garden following the election. White also used his connections to leverage appearances for Trump on friendly, right-leaning podcasts with millions of young, male listeners, although the UFC boss [told the New Yorker in November](https://want[s]%20nothing%20to%20do%20with%20politics.xn--ivg/) that he, “want\[s\] nothing to do with politics” anymore.

White is also a leader of one of Zuckerberg’s favorite pastimes: competitive fighting. Zuckerberg has [sparred](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDndhLFS839/?img_index=5) with UFC professionals; in November of 2023, he tore his ACL training for an MMA fight. Zuckerberg also agreed to cage fight X owner Elon Musk, although that battle never materialized.

“I love social media. And I’m excited to be a small part of the future of AI and emerging technologies,” White said in an Instagram [post](https://www.instagram.com/p/DEf8JEUTKJt/?hl=en&img_index=1) announcing his appointment to the board.

Last week, Meta’s President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg, the company’s top policy executive, announced he was stepping down and [passing the baton to his deputy](https://www.cnn.com/2025/01/02/tech/meta-nick-clegg-stepping-down-joel-kaplan/index.html), Joel Kaplan, one of Meta’s most prominent Republican leaders. Kaplan, who held several key roles, including deputy chief of staff for policy, in President George W. Bush’s White House before joining Meta in 2011, is “clearly the right person for the right job at the right time,” Clegg said in his announcement.

Meta has said Zuckerberg wants to take an “active role” in tech policy conversations with the incoming Trump administration. [Like other CEOs](https://www.cnn.com/2024/12/04/business/zuckerberg-trump-musk-tech-nightcap/index.html), Zuckerberg [met with Trump](https://www.cnn.com/2024/12/04/business/zuckerberg-trump-musk-tech-nightcap/index.html) at the president-elect’s Mar-a-Lago resort following the election and Meta donated $1 million to his inaugural fund.

In recent years, Meta also rolled back some [election-related content moderation efforts](https://www.cnn.com/business/tech/meta-political-ads-2020-election-lies/index.html), such as allowing users to post claims of voter fraud and political ads that question the outcome of the 2020 election — a move welcomed by Republicans who had accused the company of [“censoring” conservative voices](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/21/politics/election-social-media-misinformation-republicans/index.html). In a letter to the House Judiciary Committee over the summer, Zuckerberg also [stated](https://cnn.com/2024/08/27/media/mark-zuckerberg-election-season-republicans/index.html) that the Biden administration had “pressured” Meta to “censor” content during the pandemic, a statement that was quickly used by Trump to once again promote the false claim that the 2020 election was stolen.

Meta-Sponsored AI workshop coming to Killeen for Black History Month

By: [Josh Crawford](https://www.kxxv.com/josh-crawford)

Posted

[Josh Crawford](https://www.kxxv.com/josh-crawford)Hi! I'm Josh Crawford, your Neighborhood Reporter for Killeen.

KILLEEN, Texas (KXXV) — The Innovation Black Chamber of Commerce (IBBC) in Killeen is gearing up to host an AI & Innovation Workshop in February, sponsored by Meta. The event, part of Texas Black Business Week, will take place at the Killeen Civic and Conference Center.

It aims to provide valuable tools and resources to all attendees, regardless of their background.

"This event is for everyone who wants to learn or those who already know," Ronnie Russell, IBBC President, said. Over the past two years, Russell has hosted five AI information classes, and he is passionate about introducing artificial intelligence to the community and informing them about the best ways to use it.

The workshop will feature an ethics presentation and panel discussions, but Russell believes the grant-writing session could be the most impactful.

"We’re teaching how to write a grant with AI. All the grants that we use that we’ve written, for the past year and a half, two years, I’ve always used AI," Russell said.

For Cedric Moss, owner and operator of the Moss Foundation, a nonprofit focusing on academics and community service, developing AI skills is crucial.

"As many small businesses and nonprofits will tell you, those grants are crucial to the survival of many small businesses and nonprofits," Moss said.

Moss sees the workshop as necessary to provide for the future and educate the next generation.

Russell emphasized the importance of understanding AI and its implications for the community.

"How long will we be outside the realm of understanding what artificial intelligence is? For us to reach outside our comfort zone and see how artificial intelligence can help us as a community, we must see what we know presently," he said.

The event promises to be a transformative experience, equipping attendees with the knowledge and skills needed to thrive in a tech-based future.

"This is for you," Russell said. "Whether you’re a business owner or not, this information is for you, by you, and for us as a community because technology isn’t going anywhere, and neither is artificial intelligence."

With the new Metadata center set to open in Temple in 2026, Russell believes this workshop is an investment in the community's future. The event aims to ensure that the Killeen community is ahead of the curve when it comes to understanding and utilizing AI.

For more information and to register for the AI & Innovation Workshop, visit the IBBC website.

El pitcher de los Reales de Kansas City Michael Lorenzen en acción en el encuentro ante los Nacionales de Washington. (**AP/NICK WASS**)

**Michael Lorenzen** llegó a un acuerdo de contrato por un año y siete millones de dólares con los Reales de **Kansas City** que incluye una opción mutua para 2026, le informó el lunes a The Associated Press una persona familiarizada con el acuerdo.

La persona habló con la AP bajo condición de anonimato porque el acuerdo estaba pendiente de un examen físico exitoso. Lorenzen tendría un salario de 5,5 millones de dólares este año, y el precio de la opción para 2026 es de 12 millones de dólares, con una indemnización por rescisión de 1,5 millones de dólares.

Lorenzen, de 33 años, fue adquirido por **Kansas City** en un intercambio con Texas justo antes de la fecha límite en julio pasado y se convirtió en una parte confiable del cuerpo de lanzadores hacia el final de la temporada.

El lanzador derecho participó en siete juegos con seis aperturas y tuvo un récord de 2-0 con una efectividad de 1.57 para ayudar a los Reales a asegurar un comodín, luego lanzó 2 1/3 entradas en dos apariciones en postemporada.

Lorenzen sufrió la derrota en el Juego 1 de la Serie Divisional de la Liga Americana contra los Yankees, al permitir el sencillo de Alex Verdugo que adelantó a Nueva York en la séptima entrada de una derrota por 6-5. Los Reales finalmente perdieron la serie contra Nueva York en cuatro juegos.

Lorenzen pasó sus primeras siete temporadas en Cincinnati, luego estuvo un año con los Angelinos, antes de dividir la temporada 2023 entre los Tigres y Filis, siendo seleccionado a su único Juego de Estrellas. Tiene un récord de carrera de 47-44 con una efectividad de 3.99 y 15 salvamentos en 368 juegos, incluyendo 93 aperturas.

La cima de la rotación de abridores de los Reales parece estar definida. Michael Wacha regresó con un contrato de tres años y 51 millones de dólares para unirse a Seth Lugo y Cole Ragans, ambos fueron seleccionados al Juego de Estrellas por **Kansas City** la temporada pasada.

Los Reales esperan que Kyle Wright pueda volver a la forma que mostró en Atlanta después de pasar la última temporada rehabilitándose de una cirugía de hombro. Kris Bubic y Alec Marsh están entre los que competirán con Lorenzen por uno de los puestos restantes de abridor.

Ultimate Fighting Championship CEO Dana White speaks at an election night event for President-elect Donald Trump West Palm Beach, Florida on Nov. 6. Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta has named White to its board of directors.

Dana White, the Ultimate Fighting Championship president and supporter of President-elect Donald Trump, is joining the board of Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta.

White's election as a Meta director two weeks before Trump takes office comes as Silicon Valley is [courting the incoming administration](https://www.npr.org/2024/12/16/nx-s1-5227120/tech-executives-are-courting-trump), following what has been a frosty relationship with Trump and his allies, who have long accused tech platforms including Meta of anti-conservative bias.

Meta, Amazon, and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have [each donated $1 million to Trump's inauguration fund](https://www.npr.org/2024/12/13/nx-s1-5227874/trump-bezos-zuckerberg-amazon-facebook-open-ai-meta-inauguration-fund). Zuckerberg is among the tech titans who have dined with the president-elect at Mar-a-Lago since the election. Last week [Meta named Joel Kaplan](https://www.reuters.com/technology/meta-taps-republican-joel-kaplan-lead-global-policy-team-replacing-nick-clegg-2025-01-02/), a veteran company executive and Republican who once worked in George W. Bush's White House, its head of global policy.

White is a longtime friend of Trump [who spoke at the Republican National Convention](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/18/g-s1-11894/hulk-hogan-rnc) this summer and appeared in Trump's first TikTok video. On election night, White joined Trump on stage at his victory party, thanking many of the podcasters and [online influencers](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/21/nx-s1-5196987/influencers-are-now-a-source-of-news-for-many-americans) who, along with UFC, have been credited with boosting the president-elect's [appeal among young men](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/22/nx-s1-5152587/attending-ufc-events-is-key-for-trump-to-reach-his-political-base).

White and Zuckerberg, [who has trained as a mixed martial arts fighter](https://www.npr.org/2023/06/06/1180326042/video-mark-zuckerberg-jiu-jitsu-match-facebook), have also become friendly. Zuckerberg praised White for building UFC into "one of the most valuable, fastest growing, and most popular sports enterprises in the world" in a [Facebook post](https://www.facebook.com/zuck/posts/pfbid0e4XWTKpPFm3PP44o17EQK3LazXFLKn9ABBGAUYKKBvKo3MJDvLMehcG9Bb7yYZqPl) on Monday. "I've admired him as an entrepreneur and his ability to build such a beloved brand," Zuckerberg continued.

"I've never been interested in joining a board of directors until I got the offer to join Meta's board. I am a huge believer that social media and AI are the future," White said in a [statement](https://about.fb.com/news/2025/01/dana-white-john-elkann-charlie-songhurst-meta-board-of-directors/). White has talked with Zuckerberg about using artificial intelligence to improve UFC rankings, [ESPN reported](https://www.espn.com/mma/story/_/id/41999046/dana-white-mark-zuckerberg-talk-fixes-ufc-rankings-system) in October.

Meta also named as directors John Elkann, CEO of the European investment firm Ekon and executive chairman of carmakers Stellantis and Ferrari, and Charlie Songhurst, a tech investor who previously led corporate strategy at Microsoft. Songhurst joined a group advising Meta on AI last year.

The additions expand Meta's board from 10 to 13 directors, including Zuckerberg, who serves as chair.

"We have massive opportunities ahead in AI, wearables, and the future of social media, and our board will help us achieve our vision," Zuckerberg wrote in his Facebook post announcing the new members.

Ultimate Fighting Championship CEO Dana White speaks at an election night event for President-elect Donald Trump West Palm Beach, Florida on Nov. 6. Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta has named White to its board of directors.

Dana White, the Ultimate Fighting Championship president and supporter of President-elect Donald Trump, is joining the board of Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta.

White's election as a Meta director two weeks before Trump takes office comes as Silicon Valley is [courting the incoming administration](https://www.npr.org/2024/12/16/nx-s1-5227120/tech-executives-are-courting-trump), following what has been a frosty relationship with Trump and his allies, who have long accused tech platforms including Meta of anti-conservative bias.

Meta, Amazon, and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have [each donated $1 million to Trump's inauguration fund](https://www.npr.org/2024/12/13/nx-s1-5227874/trump-bezos-zuckerberg-amazon-facebook-open-ai-meta-inauguration-fund). Zuckerberg is among the tech titans who have dined with the president-elect at Mar-a-Lago since the election. Last week [Meta named Joel Kaplan](https://www.reuters.com/technology/meta-taps-republican-joel-kaplan-lead-global-policy-team-replacing-nick-clegg-2025-01-02/), a veteran company executive and Republican who once worked in George W. Bush's White House, its head of global policy.

White is a longtime friend of Trump [who spoke at the Republican National Convention](https://www.npr.org/2024/07/18/g-s1-11894/hulk-hogan-rnc) this summer and appeared in Trump's first TikTok video. On election night, White joined Trump on stage at his victory party, thanking many of the podcasters and [online influencers](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/21/nx-s1-5196987/influencers-are-now-a-source-of-news-for-many-americans) who, along with UFC, have been credited with boosting the president-elect's [appeal among young men](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/22/nx-s1-5152587/attending-ufc-events-is-key-for-trump-to-reach-his-political-base).

White and Zuckerberg, [who has trained as a mixed martial arts fighter](https://www.npr.org/2023/06/06/1180326042/video-mark-zuckerberg-jiu-jitsu-match-facebook), have also become friendly. Zuckerberg praised White for building UFC into "one of the most valuable, fastest growing, and most popular sports enterprises in the world" in a [Facebook post](https://www.facebook.com/zuck/posts/pfbid0e4XWTKpPFm3PP44o17EQK3LazXFLKn9ABBGAUYKKBvKo3MJDvLMehcG9Bb7yYZqPl) on Monday. "I've admired him as an entrepreneur and his ability to build such a beloved brand," Zuckerberg continued.

"I've never been interested in joining a board of directors until I got the offer to join Meta's board. I am a huge believer that social media and AI are the future," White said in a [statement](https://about.fb.com/news/2025/01/dana-white-john-elkann-charlie-songhurst-meta-board-of-directors/). White has talked with Zuckerberg about using artificial intelligence to improve UFC rankings, [ESPN reported](https://www.espn.com/mma/story/_/id/41999046/dana-white-mark-zuckerberg-talk-fixes-ufc-rankings-system) in October.

Meta also named as directors John Elkann, CEO of the European investment firm Ekon and executive chairman of carmakers Stellantis and Ferrari, and Charlie Songhurst, a tech investor who previously led corporate strategy at Microsoft. Songhurst joined a group advising Meta on AI last year.

The additions expand Meta's board from 10 to 13 directors, including Zuckerberg, who serves as chair.

"We have massive opportunities ahead in AI, wearables, and the future of social media, and our board will help us achieve our vision," Zuckerberg wrote in his Facebook post announcing the new members.
